intro: Gynoxys rimachiana, commonly known as the Andean star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is known for its vibrant pink or purple blooms. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Gynoxys rimachiana is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its striking appearance.
